content: "http://www.newsok.com/house-bypasses-governors-veto-to-claim-oklahomas-sovereignty/article/3366762" HCR1028 "WHEREAS, today, in 2009, the states are demonstrably treated as agents of the federal government; and WHEREAS, many federal laws are directly in violation of the Tenth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States; and WHEREAS, the Tenth Amendment assures that we, the people of the United States of America and each sovereign state in the Union of States, now have, and have always had, rights the federal government may not usurp; and " "THAT this serve as Notice and Demand to the federal government, as our agent, to cease and desist, effective immediately, mandates that are beyond the scope of these constitutionally delegated powers." Still to be passed by Senate and signed off on (If the Ok Gov. even does". Funny though, where was all of this for the past 8 years when the Federal Goverment was still breaching States rights...more so than any time in the history of this nation. If W was still in there, they would pass a resolution of support no matter what.... give me a break....

content: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Could that not be considered a breach of free speech as well? No. There is no restriction on speaking or printing <insert non-english language here>. What this will do is remove requirements to provide everything from driving tests to job applications in multiple languages. If people choose to provide multilingual services, they can, but they will not be forced to.
quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Could that not be considered a breach of free speech as well?
reply: No. There is no restriction on speaking or printing <insert non-english language here>. What this will do is remove requirements to provide everything from driving tests to job applications in multiple languages. If people choose to provide multilingual services, they can, but they will not be forced to.

content: "Declaring English the official language means that official government business at all levels must be conducted solely in English. This includes all public documents, records, legislation and regulations, as well as hearings, official ceremonies and public meetings." It already is and has been since we were a soverign country. Last time I looked, the US Constitution was written in the English language, the business of government is and has always been transacted in English, everything legal is in English. So what's the problem, and why do we need to have some ridiculous law that states what everyone knows is obvious? "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson
reply: "Declaring English the official language means that official government business at all levels must be conducted solely in English. content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: quote: Originally posted by jwr6: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: "http://www.newsok.com/house-bypasses-governors-veto-to-claim-oklahomas-sovereignty/article/3366762" HCR1028 "WHEREAS, today, in 2009, the states are demonstrably treated as agents of the federal government; and WHEREAS, many federal laws are directly in violation of the Tenth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States; and WHEREAS, the Tenth Amendment assures that we, the people of the United States of America and each sovereign state in the Union of States, now have, and have always had, rights the federal government may not usurp; and " "THAT this serve as Notice and Demand to the federal government, as our agent, to cease and desist, effective immediately, mandates that are beyond the scope of these constitutionally delegated powers." Still to be passed by Senate and signed off on (If the Ok Gov. even does". Funny though, where was all of this for the past 8 years when the Federal Goverment was still breaching States rights...more so than any time in the history of this nation. If W was still in there, they would pass a resolution of support no matter what.... give me a break.... What states' rights were breached during the last 8 years? What state rights were breached under President Obama? AFAIK, and as determined by the USSC so far, none. Same number as was breached by Bush, Crackerjack's unfounded assertations notwithstanding. If a state sues the federal government over some federal law or action and it gets taken to the USSC and ruled unconstitutional per the 10th, then we will have proof that either one of them did. Until then, "Bush imprisoned terrorists" and "Obama's funding abortions" may get the left or right all frothy at the mouth, but they aren't 10th amendment violations. ETA: Nobody wants to admit it, but in reality, states don't have rights. Example, the federal government likes to say that votor registration and elections or firearms laws are "state's rights" issues. However, that doesn't stop the federal government from continuing to "monitor" states that had a history of election issues 40 years ago or coming up with federal firearms restrictions. So, if states only have the rights that the federal government wants them to have, they don't have rights...they have priviledges.

What state rights were breached under President Obama?
reply: AFAIK, and as determined by the USSC so far, none. Same number as was breached by Bush, Crackerjack's unfounded assertations notwithstanding. If a state sues the federal government over some federal law or action and it gets taken to the USSC and ruled unconstitutional per the 10th, then we will have proof that either one of them did. Until then, "Bush imprisoned terrorists" and "Obama's funding abortions" may get the left or right all frothy at the mouth, but they aren't 10th amendment violations. ETA: Nobody wants to admit it, but in reality, states don't have rights. Example, the federal government likes to say that votor registration and elections or firearms laws are "state's rights" issues. However, that doesn't stop the federal government from continuing to "monitor" states that had a history of election issues 40 years ago or coming up with federal firearms restrictions. So, if states only have the rights that the federal government wants them to have, they don't have rights...they have priviledges.

content: These people are Statists. You people better understand that the only time these kinds of Right Wingers preach for STates' rights is when individual states discriminate against minorities and blacks. Example: When schools were ordered to de-segregate, individual southern states closed down every single public school that was ordered to admit black children. In the meantime, states sent White parents vouchers so that the parents can use those same vouchers to send their spoiled rotten daughters and pink princess sons to private schools. The boll-weavel southern democrats fought tooth and nail for states' rights; they demanded that states have the say-so about how to spend state funds when the Federal Government ordered the de-segregated public schools re-opened, and the vouchers to stop. But make no mistake: The Right wingers want Big Government in order for Big Government to put an end to bussing programs designed to do away with de-facto de-segregation. Right Wing Supramasists are not patriotic, although they stick a yellow ribbon on their SUV and wear the magic American flag pin. Using common scense, we know that, given America's status as a world power, when the President looks terrible, america looks terrible. Depsite this knowledge, and to the detriment of the Presidency, they did not hesitate to bring up Obama's Citizenship to public debate. If this case actually proceeeded to the US Supreme Court, the front pages of the World's Press would be filled with media coverage about the case, to the embarrassment of this country.

content: "http://www.newsok.com/house-bypasses-governors-veto-to-claim-oklahomas-sovereignty/article/3366762" HCR1028 "WHEREAS, today, in 2009, the states are demonstrably treated as agents of the federal government; and WHEREAS, many federal laws are directly in violation of the Tenth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States; and WHEREAS, the Tenth Amendment assures that we, the people of the United States of America and each sovereign state in the Union of States, now have, and have always had, rights the federal government may not usurp; and " "THAT this serve as Notice and Demand to the federal government, as our agent, to cease and desist, effective immediately, mandates that are beyond the scope of these constitutionally delegated powers." content: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Could that not be considered a breach of free speech as well? No. There is no restriction on speaking or printing <insert non-english language here>. What this will do is remove requirements to provide everything from driving tests to job applications in multiple languages. If people choose to provide multilingual services, they can, but they will not be forced to.
quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: Could that not be considered a breach of free speech as well?
reply: No. There is no restriction on speaking or printing <insert non-english language here>. What this will do is remove requirements to provide everything from driving tests to job applications in multiple languages. If people choose to provide multilingual services, they can, but they will not be forced to.

content: "Declaring English the official language means that official government business at all levels must be conducted solely in English. This includes all public documents, records, legislation and regulations, as well as hearings, official ceremonies and public meetings." It already is and has been since we were a soverign country. Last time I looked, the US Constitution was written in the English language, the business of government is and has always been transacted in English, everything legal is in English. So what's the problem, and why do we need to have some ridiculous law that states what everyone knows is obvious? "I believe that banking institutions are more dangerous to our liberties than standing armies." - T. Jefferson
reply: "Declaring English the official language means that official government business at all levels must be conducted solely in English. content: quote: Originally posted by jack_flats: quote: Originally posted by jwr6: quote: Originally posted by crackerjacks61: "http://www.newsok.com/house-bypasses-governors-veto-to-claim-oklahomas-sovereignty/article/3366762" HCR1028 "WHEREAS, today, in 2009, the states are demonstrably treated as agents of the federal government; and WHEREAS, many federal laws are directly in violation of the Tenth Amendment to the Constitution of the United States; and WHEREAS, the Tenth Amendment assures that we, the people of the United States of America and each sovereign state in the Union of States, now have, and have always had, rights the federal government may not usurp; and " "THAT this serve as Notice and Demand to the federal government, as our agent, to cease and desist, effective immediately, mandates that are beyond the scope of these constitutionally delegated powers." Still to be passed by Senate and signed off on (If the Ok Gov. even does". Funny though, where was all of this for the past 8 years when the Federal Goverment was still breaching States rights...more so than any time in the history of this nation. If W was still in there, they would pass a resolution of support no matter what.... give me a break.... What states' rights were breached during the last 8 years? What state rights were breached under President Obama? AFAIK, and as determined by the USSC so far, none. Same number as was breached by Bush, Crackerjack's unfounded assertations notwithstanding. If a state sues the federal government over some federal law or action and it gets taken to the USSC and ruled unconstitutional per the 10th, then we will have proof that either one of them did. Until then, "Bush imprisoned terrorists" and "Obama's funding abortions" may get the left or right all frothy at the mouth, but they aren't 10th amendment violations. ETA: Nobody wants to admit it, but in reality, states don't have rights. Example, the federal government likes to say that votor registration and elections or firearms laws are "state's rights" issues. However, that doesn't stop the federal government from continuing to "monitor" states that had a history of election issues 40 years ago or coming up with federal firearms restrictions. So, if states only have the rights that the federal government wants them to have, they don't have rights...they have priviledges.

Until then, "Bush imprisoned terrorists" and "Obama's funding abortions" may get the left or right all frothy at the mouth, but they aren't 10th amendment violations. ETA: Nobody wants to admit it, but in reality, states don't have rights. Example, the federal government likes to say that votor registration and elections or firearms laws are "state's rights" issues. content: These people are Statists. You people better understand that the only time these kinds of Right Wingers preach for STates' rights is when individual states discriminate against minorities and blacks. Example: When schools were ordered to de-segregate, individual southern states closed down every single public school that was ordered to admit black children. In the meantime, states sent White parents vouchers so that the parents can use those same vouchers to send their spoiled rotten daughters and pink princess sons to private schools. The boll-weavel southern democrats fought tooth and nail for states' rights; they demanded that states have the say-so about how to spend state funds when the Federal Government ordered the de-segregated public schools re-opened, and the vouchers to stop. But make no mistake: The Right wingers want Big Government in order for Big Government to put an end to bussing programs designed to do away with de-facto de-segregation. Right Wing Supramasists are not patriotic, although they stick a yellow ribbon on their SUV and wear the magic American flag pin. Using common scense, we know that, given America's status as a world power, when the President looks terrible, america looks terrible. Depsite this knowledge, and to the detriment of the Presidency, they did not hesitate to bring up Obama's Citizenship to public debate. If this case actually proceeeded to the US Supreme Court, the front pages of the World's Press would be filled with media coverage about the case, to the embarrassment of this country.
